intro: Echium vulgare var. minus, commonly known as lesser thimbleweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and often have a bluish-green hue. This species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields, where it thrives in full sun.
